messages.content: So this morning I woke up at 4 a.m. and yesterday I went to bed probably 9 p.m. 9 20 p.m. and then um the oh I woke up once to pee I forgot one I don't know one and then this morning woke up uh the left levator scapula just feel pain um the muscle was still strained from yesterday or the day before um and then um and then I actually got off of bed probably 6 40 a.m. had my morning anti-reflux medication and then I lay on the floor with the heat to try to um relax the muscle on the left side um that helped a bit and then I ate my bread first um had one cup of uh um one cup of um kashiko cereal one cup of one percent milk um probably one third cup of blueberries and one slice of whole wheat bread um and then I went to take an outdoor walk between 8 40 to between 8 a.m. and 8 40 a.m.

You‚Äôre pacing movement well with gentle morning walk. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
the pain level of the left levator scap pain was about 6 /10; it's not left headache, ther'es no left headache at this moment

Log saved FieldDetailsLeft-headache pain (0-10)Episode ID linkL-LevScap-0813-04:00 Episode sub-table IDSymptomStartEnd/durInitPeakReliefEnv/PillowL-LevScap-0813-04:00Left levator-scapula muscle strain04:0066Heat on floorfloor mat Reflections That clarifies things‚Äîneck muscle, not headache. Let‚Äôs capture when the pain eases so we can see how long these flare-ups last and what helps most. Hydration‚Äôs only ~8 oz so far; another bottle soon could aid muscle recovery. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
Lunch, I ate at Panera, around 30 to 12. I had a Pikachu, or strawberry poppy seed salad without chicken, and the chicken Fontana sandwich.

Log saved FieldDetailsMeals & times (food, caffeine, alcohol)07:00 ‚Äì 1 c Kashi Go + 1 c 1 % milk + ‚Öì c blueberries + 1 slice whole-wheat bread 11:30 ‚Äì Panera: strawberry-poppy-seed salad (no chicken) + Chicken Fontina sandwich Reflections Two histamine/tyramine items today (strawberries + aged Fontina cheese) put you over the 1-per-day amine comfort zone‚Äîlet‚Äôs watch for any uptick in head-neck pain. üå∂Ô∏è Prompt: When did the left levator-scap episode ease off (or is it still >0)? Knowing the end-time lets us gauge duration and what helps most. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
How is strawberry also migraine trigger? It‚Äôs toasted frontega chicken sandwich

Log saved FieldDetailsMeals & times (food, caffeine, alcohol)07:00 ‚Äì 1 c Kashi GO, 1 c 1 % milk, ‚Öì c blueberries, 1 slice whole-wheat bread 11:30 ‚Äì Panera: strawberry poppy-seed salad (no chicken) and Toasted Frontega Chicken sandwich ‚Äî smoked pulled chicken, fresh mozzarella, vine-ripened tomatoes, red onion, fresh basil, chipotle aioli on black-pepper focaccia (row corrected to show Frontega sandwich & ingredient details) Reflections Migraine-trigger maths: strawberries aren‚Äôt classic tyramine foods, but they‚Äôre high-salicylate ‚Äúhistamine liberators‚Äù in some people. If you‚Äôve never noticed a link, they may be harmless for you; the bigger potential combo today is vine tomatoes + chipotle aioli + red onion (common reflux & migraine triggers) versus the fresh mozzarella (low-amine). Reflux watch: spicy aioli, tomato, basil & pepper focaccia add 3+ reflux foods in one meal‚Äîconsider extra water and an earlier Famotidine dose if burn crops up. Still need: end-time/current level of that levator-scap episode, and today‚Äôs hydration total so far. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
I'm going to test a new pillow for the napping to see whether it helps to relax the left scapula muscle, the left levator scapulae muscle.

Log saved FieldDetailsPosture breaks / Neck exercisesHeat therapy floor session AM ‚ûú Testing new pillow during nap for levator-scap relief Reflections Smart mini-experiment‚Äînote pain level just before the nap and again when you wake to judge the pillow‚Äôs impact. Let me know when/if the episode eases plus today‚Äôs fluid tally so far. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?

It's 3.02am right now. I tested the new pillow. I was not able to fall asleep, but the new pillow seemed to be fine. I also feel like it helped relieve the tension on the levator scapula. Let's sleep for a night to see how it looks like.

Log saved FieldDetailsDate2025-08-14Time03:02Posture breaks / Neck exercisesTried new pillow while resting; felt levator-scap tension easeNotes (weather change, hormones, travel, etc.)Couldn‚Äôt fall asleep yet; will test pillow through the nightEpisode ID linkL-LevScap-0813-04:00 (reports relief with pillow) Reflections Nice first result from the pillow trial! üôå ‚Ä¢ Could you give a quick 0-10 pain rating right now so we can mark whether the episode is ending? ‚Ä¢ When you do head to sleep, drop the actual bed-time (and tomorrow‚Äôs wake-time) so we can log sleep quality. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
my head is feeling a bit cloudy at this moment, and tiny bit right side temple pain level 1 I'd suppose

Log saved FieldDetailsMood / emotionsHead feels cloudyRight-side migraine pain (0-10)1Episode ID linkR-Mig-0814-03:02 Episode sub-table IDSymptomStartEnd/durInitPeakReliefEnv/PillowR-Mig-0814-03:02Right-temple ache / cloudy head03:0211‚Äìtesting new pillow Reflections Early flicker on the right temple‚Äîcould be prodrome or just overtired. Jot when (and if) pain climbs above 1 or eases so we can close out the episode and spot triggers. Hydration + actual bedtime still open; both affect overnight headache risk. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
What are my medications

Your current medication lineup (organized the way clinicians usually think about it) CategoryMedicine & Typical ScheduleWhat it‚Äôs for / notesDaily scheduled (preventive)Pantoprazole 40 mg AM ‚Äì acid-blocker for refluxFamotidine 20 mg DIN ‚Äì evening acid controlAmitriptyline 25 mg 20:00 ‚Äì migraine & sleep maintenanceCore reflux + migraine-preventive stackDaily inhaled asthma controlFluticasone/Salmeterol (DPI at night)Trelegy Ellipta 200/62.5/25 ¬µg ‚Äì 1 puff daily Keeps baseline airway inflammation/tone downMonthly biologicEmgality Pen 120 mg SC ‚Äì inject every 4 weeks CGRP-mAb to raise your migraine thresholdRescue / as-neededAlbuterol HFA 90 ¬µg ‚Äì 2 puffs up to QID PRN (quick-relief inhaler)Ubrelvy 100 mg (ubrogepant) ‚Äì 1 tab at migraine onset Acetaminophen (OTC) ‚Äì pain days; keep ‚â§10 days/moDoxylamine 12.5 mg ‚Äì occasional insomniaToradol (ketorolac) IM ‚Äì clinic-only rescue dose noted in July visit Other PRN / situationalScopolamine 1 mg patch ‚Äì change q72 h as needed for motion sickness Triamcinolone 0.1 % dental paste ‚Äì 2-3√ó/day for mouth ulcers Supplements you log dailyMg 120 mg, Riboflavin (B‚ÇÇ) 400 mg, Fish-oil √ó3, Ashwagandha 500 mg, Vit D 1000 IU + Ca 280 mg, Liquid IVNutrient support & hydration boost How to use this list Keep the ‚Äúdaily scheduled‚Äù pieces truly daily‚Äîmissing doses (especially pantoprazole, amitriptyline or Trelegy) can let symptoms creep back. Rescue meds (Ubrelvy, Acetaminophen, Albuterol) work best when taken early but watch monthly limits to avoid rebound or overuse. Emgality injects: log the exact date each month so we can spot waning effect before the end of a cycle. Let every provider know about the scopolamine, triamcinolone and your supplements‚Äîthey can interact with new prescriptions or procedures. As always, confirm any changes with your prescribing clinicians. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?

So I wanted to see my neurologist May 30 to Fall 30. By the time I was there, I was having minor migraines, still migraine level 1. And then coming back, I had dinner of rice porridge, baguette that I air fried in garlic olive oil, also air fried eggs, some steamed broccolis.

Log saved FieldDetailsMeals & times (food, caffeine, alcohol)07:00 ‚Äì 1 c Kashi GO, 1 c 1 % milk, ‚Öì c blueberries, 1 slice whole-wheat bread11:30 ‚Äì Panera strawberry-poppy-seed salad (no chicken) + Toasted Frontega Chicken sandwich‚âà18:30 ‚Äì Dinner at home: rice porridge, baguette toasted in garlic-olive-oil, two air-fried eggs, steamed broccoli Reflections Garlic-olive-oil baguette plus chipotle aioli earlier brings today‚Äôs reflux-food count to 4‚Äîabove your 2-per-day comfort zone. If you feel chest burn overnight, consider an extra sip of water or earlier Famotidine tomorrow. Still open for today: ‚Ä¢ Total hydration so far? ‚Ä¢ Current pain levels (levator-scap & right-temple episodes) and whether either episode has ended. ‚Ä¢ Actual bedtime once you turn in, so we can log sleep. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
Oh, I'm not sure about today's migraine. What is triggering it? I did have a bad sleep, but then also the left neck has been really tight. Oh no. I don't know what triggered for today.

Log saved FieldDetailsNotes (weather change, hormones, travel, etc.)Poor sleep + tight left levator-scap; unsure migraine trigger Reflections Likeliest culprits: (1) fragmented 6 h sleep and middle-of-night wake ‚Üí lowered migraine threshold; (2) sustained neck-muscle tension acting as a local trigger; (3) stacked dietary provokers (chipotle aioli, garlic-oil baguette, tomatoes, strawberries) add histamine / reflux load. Worth tracking whether improving tonight‚Äôs sleep or stretching the neck drops tomorrow‚Äôs ache. Missing pieces that help spot patterns: today‚Äôs hydration total and current pain ratings (levator-scap & right-temple) so we can close those episodes. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
Can you please separate histamine versus reflux? They cannot be mixed together.

Log saved FieldDetails Reflections ‚Ä¢ Separate buckets Histamine / amine-heavy migraine foods (today: fresh strawberries, vine-ripened tomatoes, aged basil pesto-style herbs) vs. classic reflux irritants (today: chipotle aioli, garlic-oil baguette, black-pepper focaccia). Keeping two columns in your diary can show whether head pain or heart-burn spikes first. ‚Ä¢ Quick check-in: how many ounces have you drunk so far, and where do the levator-scap & right-temple pains sit now (0-10)? Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
You think strawberries and tomatoes are also contributing to the migraine fluid? Why is that the case?

Log saved FieldDetails Reflections Here‚Äôs why strawberries and tomatoes sometimes show up on migraine-trigger lists: Histamine angle ‚Äì Tomatoes actually contain measurable histamine, and strawberries can cause your own mast cells to release histamine. Extra histamine in the bloodstream can dilate vessels and irritate trigeminal nerve endings, lowering the brain‚Äôs ‚Äúmigraine threshold.‚Äù HealthlinePMC Other vaso-active compounds ‚Äì Tomatoes are also one of the few veggies with tyramine and plenty of free glutamate; both have been linked to headaches in sensitive brains. Individual variability ‚Äì Only about 20‚Äì30 % of people with migraine react to these foods. Keeping them in your diary lets you see if they line up with attack days for you. So strawberries + tomatoes aren‚Äôt automatic villains, but if they land on the same day as poor sleep or neck tension they can act like the ‚Äúlast straw‚Äù that tips you into an attack. A quick experiment: try a few strawberry-free / tomato-free days while everything else stays the same and watch whether the right-temple flicker still appears. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
How much calories do you think I ate today?

Log saved FieldDetailsCalories (kcal)‚âà 1 990 (‚âà380 breakfast + ~1 100 Panera combo ‚Äì 220 salad Eat This Much + ~880 full Frontega sandwich, doubling the ¬Ω-sandwich value of 440 MyNetDiary + ‚âà510 home-cooked dinner) Reflections Roughly 2 000 kcal puts you right around a maintenance day for your height/weight. The Panera lunch was the biggest chunk (~55 % of the day); breakfast and home dinner were moderate. If you‚Äôre tracking macros next, we‚Äôd need exact portions (rice vs. porridge volume, baguette ounces, oil teaspoons) to refine carbs/fat breakdown. Still open today: hydration total and current pain ratings so we can close those two episodes and see if the pillow experiment holds overnight. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
It‚Äôs actually only half of the sandwiches

Log saved FieldDetailsCalories (kcal)‚âà 1 550 ‚âà380 (AM) + 660 (Panera: 220 salad Eat This Much + 440 ¬Ω-Frontega sandwich MyNetDiary) + ‚âà510 (dinner) Reflections Swapping in a half Frontega drops today‚Äôs total by ~440 kcal, landing you near 1 550 kcal‚Äîcloser to your ‚Äúlight day‚Äù intake. Good clarification! If weight maintenance feels right here, you can use the same salad-plus-half-sandwich combo again. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
I had a cup of 1%milk

Log saved FieldDetailsMeals & times (food, caffeine, alcohol)07:00 ‚Äì 1 c Kashi GO, 1 c 1 % milk, ‚Öì c blueberries, 1 slice whole-wheat bread 11:30 ‚Äì Panera strawberry-poppy-seed salad (no chicken) + ¬Ω Toasted Frontega Chicken sandwich 18:30 ‚Äì Rice porridge, garlic-oil air-fried baguette, 2 air-fried eggs, steamed broccoli ‚âà03:05 ‚Äì 1 c 1 % milkHydration (oz)16 oz (two cups 1 % milk so far)Calories (kcal)‚âà 1 650 Reflections Late-night milk tops up calcium/protein and adds fluid‚Äîgood for muscle recovery, but give yourself at least 30 min upright before lying down to keep reflux quiet. Hydration‚Äôs still modest; a water bottle on the bedside could nudge you toward your 64 oz goal tomorrow. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
I‚Äôve also been a bit gassy since lunch

Log saved FieldDetailsReflux symptoms (burn / lump / cool 0-5)Gassy / bloating ‚âà 1 Reflections Garlic-oil baguette plus raw onion & aioli can ferment in the gut and spark gas later in the day. A slow stroll, warm water, or gentle torso twists may help it pass; if you notice heart-burn creeping in, rate it 0-5 so we can track pattern and med timing. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
Pillow. It's better to have your neck to be empty between bed. Or it's better to have your entire shoulder on top of the pillow.

Log saved FieldDetailsPosture breaks / Neck exercisesContinuing new-pillow trial; wondering if neck-gap vs. shoulder-on-pillow setup gives best levator-scap relief Reflections A neutral spine is the goal. For most people that means: Back- or side-sleeping: let the pillow fill the space from shoulder to base of skull, so your neck is supported but shoulders stay on the mattress. A too-high stack that props the entire shoulder on the pillow can crank the levator-scap; a too-low pillow leaves the neck hanging. Quick check: when you‚Äôre lying down, imagine a straight line from mid-back through the back of your head. If your chin tips up or down, tweak height or add/remove a thin towel layer until that line is level. Give each tweak one full night, then rate morning neck pain (0-10) to see which setup truly helps. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?

Half-life for histamine and tyramine, how much amount are we talking about? Do you have like a measurement of the amount that we can use, such as caffeine? You cannot take more than 65 milligrams caffeine, that kind of way.

Log saved FieldDetails (no new symptom-tracker rows from this Q&A turn) Reflections ‚Äî ‚ÄúHow much is too much?‚Äù HistamineTyramineWhere it‚Äôs broken downDAO enzyme in gut + HNMT in liver/kidneyMAO-A in gut-wall & liverPlasma half-life in healthy adults3 ‚Äì 6 min (range 2-20 min reported) PubMedScienceDirect‚âà 0.5 h (32 min) after an oral dose PubMedResearch ‚Äúchallenge‚Äù doses that start to cause symptoms75 mg swallowed at once triggered flushing/rapid heart-beat in 50 % of healthy volunteers; the same dose is often used as a ‚Äútolerance test.‚Äù MDPI6 mg in a single meal is the conservative ‚Äúmigraine/M AOI caution‚Äù limit; ‚â• 25 mg in a meal is the level where sharp BP spikes or headaches become common. ScienceDirectRule-of-thumb for daily eatingKeep each meal ‚â§ 50 mg if you suspect histamine intolerance; stay under ~100 mg/day total (highly individual!)Aim for < 10 mg per meal if you‚Äôre tyramine-sensitive; avoid > 40 mg/day from aged/fermented foods.Why numbers are fuzzyHistamine content fluctuates wildly (fresh tomato ‚âà 1 mg/100 g; 5-day-old tuna > 400 mg/100 g). DAO capacity, gut microbes, alcohol and estrogen levels all change clearance.Tyramine rises as proteins age/ferment; MAO activity differs by genetics, meds, stress hormones.Practical ‚Äútraffic-light‚Äù guideGreen (<5 mg/serving): fresh fruits/veg, pasteurized milk, same-day cooked meat.Yellow (5-30 mg): strawberries, tomato paste, avocado, spinach, fresh mozzarella.Red (>30 mg): aged cheese (Parmesan ‚âà 40 mg/oz), leftover fish, kombucha, sauerkraut.Green (<2 mg): fresh chicken, eggs, most veg.Yellow (2-10 mg): half-banana, fresh cheddar, soy sauce splash.Red (>10 mg): salami (20-40 mg/oz), pepperoni pizza slice, very ripe bananas, craft beer. Key take-aways for your diary Histamine & tyramine clear fast, so it‚Äôs the total load over several hours (plus DAO/MAO capacity) that matters more than yesterday‚Äôs menu. If you want caffeine-style numbers to experiment with, start by capping histamine ~50 mg/meal and tyramine ~6 mg/meal for two weeks. Log any migraine or reflux flares; then loosen or tighten as patterns emerge. Use freshness as an easy proxy: the longer a protein sits or ferments, the higher both amines climb. (This overview is for self-tracking; always confirm limits with your dietitian or neurologist, especially if you ever use MAOI meds.) Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
Why do you mention about pasteurized milk? Is fresh milk pasteurized milk?

Log saved FieldDetails Reflections Why I singled-out pasteurized milk Pasteurization = safety + low histamine. Heating milk (e.g., 63 ¬∞C √ó 30 min or 72 ¬∞C √ó 15 s) knocks out most bacteria that generate histamine as milk ages. Surveys show pasteurized milk typically sits at 0.3 ‚Äì 0.7 mg histamine / kg, whereas the same volume of raw milk or any fermented dairy can climb 10-fold or more. PMC Raw (unpasteurized) milk isn‚Äôt ‚Äúfresh‚Äù in a migraine sense. Even straight from the farm it carries live microbes that keep producing amines during transport and storage, so the histamine content is unpredictable‚Äîand the food-safety risk is higher. Verywell Health ‚ÄúFresh milk‚Äù on U.S. grocery shelves is almost always pasteurized. Unless the label says ‚Äúraw‚Äù (sold only in a handful of states), the carton you buy‚Äîwhole, 2 %, 1 %, skim‚Äîis pasteurized. Opening it promptly and using it within a few days keeps amine build-up negligible. What about tyramine? Plain milk‚Äîpasteurized or raw‚Äîcontains trivial tyramine (<1 mg/kg). It becomes an issue only once milk is cultured or aged into cheese or yogurt, when certain bacteria convert amino acids into tyramine. PMC Practical take-away If you tolerate milk now, stick with reasonably fresh pasteurized cartons, refrigerate promptly, and you‚Äôre already at the low end of the histamine/Tyramine spectrum‚Äîno special cap like the ‚Äú65 mg caffeine‚Äù rule needed. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
can you provide the full entry of 2025-08-13

Reflections Different calendar day, same wake-cycle‚Äîeasy to mix up at 3 a.m.! The right-side migraine is in the 08-14 table with its own Episode ID; once you tell me when it ends (or if it ramps up), I‚Äôll close it with a duration and summary. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
can you summarize each episode into a separate paragraph

Log saved FieldDetails Reflections Left levator-scap episode (ID L-LevScap-0813-04:00) ‚Äì Began around 04 : 00 on 08-13 with a sharp 6 /10 pull along the left levator-scapula after a short-sleep night. Floor heat therapy took the edge off but did not lower the numeric pain. A trial of a new pillow later eased tension, yet we still need the first pain-free reading to close the episode and capture its duration and peak-to-relief pattern. Right-temple migraine flicker (ID R-Mig-0814-03:02) ‚Äì Surfaced at 03 : 02 on 08-14 as a cloudy-headed 1 /10 ache. Likely cofactors: cumulative sleep debt, lingering neck strain, and yesterday‚Äôs tomato-garlic-aioli stack. No meds taken so far; watch if it rises beyond 1 or fades after quality sleep so we can record an end-time and gauge whether neck or diet pushed it over threshold. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?

Right-temple migraine flicker (ID R-Mig-0814-03:02 , this episode actually started on 3:30pm when I was meeting the pain management doctor in their office and it kind of stopped at 6pm with salanpass patches, however, there's heavy fog in the head at night afterwards, going to sleep, there's tiny bit pain

Log saved FieldDetailsRight-side migraine pain (0-10)1Episode ID linkL-LevScap-0813-04:00, R-Mig-0813-15:30 Episode sub-table IDSymptomStartEnd/durInitPeakReliefEnv/PillowR-Mig-0813-15:30Right-temple migraine + brain-fog15:3018:00 (2 h 30 m)11Salonpas patches @ 18:00Doctor‚Äôs office ‚Üí home Reflections Left levator-scap strain (L-LevScap-0813-04:00): Began pre-dawn at 6/10, held steady through the day. Heat therapy took the edge off; experimenting with a contour pillow later that night finally eased the tightness, but we still need the first pain-free reading to close the episode. Right-temple migraine (R-Mig-0813-15:30): Sparked mildly (1/10) during your 3:30 PM pain-management visit, likely from clinic posture + neck tension. Salonpas at 6 PM quieted the pain, yet a ‚Äúfoggy‚Äù head lingered into the night with a tiny ache at bedtime and at 03:02. If that flicker fades to 0 after sleep, we‚Äôll mark the episode fully resolved; otherwise we‚Äôll extend its end-time. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
also note that it's day1 trying the white pillow

Log saved FieldDetailsPosture breaks / Neck exercisesHeat-therapy floor session AM ‚Üí Day 1 trial of new white pillow (nap + overnight) Reflections Great‚Äîmarking this as the first night with the white pillow so we can compare morning neck scores over the next week. Make a quick note tomorrow of how the levator-scap feels on waking (0-10) to gauge benefit. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
